channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-13335] Update ClientSmallScanner and ClientSmallReversedScanner
item.description:
Some follow-on work for HBASE-13262:

it's unlikely that clients using the small scanners would get enough data to run into the initial bug, but the scanner implementations should still adhere to the moreResultsInRegion flag when the server sends it.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: First attempt at a patch to update ClientSmallScanner and ClientSmallReversedScanner. Fairly straightforward – tests included.

This seems specific to scanner callables, not a generic callable factory (callables can be any method). 


+public interface RetryingCallableFactory {

Maybe we can make it an internal class. Other than that LGTM. Nice tests!

Thanks for taking a look.

not a generic callable factory (callables can be any method).

That's a good point. I meant it was o.a.h.hbase.client.RetryingCallable, but the name doesn't quite denote that well

Maybe we can make it an internal class

Suggestions? Inner class on ClientSmallScanner? Something else?

Maybe get rid of RetryingCallableFactory, and only keep SmallScanRetryingCallableFactory and put it in ClientSmallScanner. Or we can make a ScannerCallableFactory as a base and put the base in AbstractClientScanner.

SGTM. I'll take a glance and see if I can find something concrete that would lead to more consolidation across all of the scanner impls and choose one of your recommendations based on what looks best long term.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment

against master branch at commit 3815a33e3400cee73f63e205afac8f1a2d9c174f.

This message is automatically generated.
+1. Jonathan Lawlor, Andrew Purtell, Lars Hofhansl do you guys want to take a look?

+1, these changes look good to me. Those tests look great.

It may also be a good idea to extend TestSizeFailures so that it also tests to ensure that all data is seen when the scan is small (e.g. perform that same scan near the end with but configure it with Scan.setSmall(true)). Even though that wouldn't be a "small" scan, it would test to make sure the fix behaves as expected.

It may also be a good idea to extend TestSizeFailures so that it also tests to ensure that all data is seen when the scan is small (e.g. perform that same scan near the end with but configure it with Scan.setSmall(true)). Even though that wouldn't be a "small" scan, it would test to make sure the fix behaves as expected.

Easy enough. I can grab that in some follow on if everything else looks good as-is (to avoid having to reconstruct another set of patches).
Sounds good to me
Josh Elser should I wait for commit, or you want to do a follow up issue?
IMO go for it as they are. No need to wait on what's already here.
I've pushed this. Thanks Josh for the patch.
